Manishtushu (ğ’ˆ ğ’€­ğ’…–ğ’Œ…ğ’‹¢, Ma-an-ish-tu-su)[2] was the third king of the Akkadian Empire, reigning from c. 2270 BC until his assassination in 2255 BC (Middle Chronology).[3] He was the son of Sargon the Great, the founder of the Akkadian Empire, and he was succeeded by his son, Naram-Sin.
